revision.text:
{{More citations needed|date=March 2009}} {{Infobox website | name = SixDegrees.com | logo = SixDegrees.com logo.png | screenshot = | caption = | url = {{URL|http://sixdegrees.com/}} | commercial = | type = [[Social network service]] | registration = Required | owner = MacroView (1997-1999) YouthStream Media Networks
(1999-2001) | author = [[Andrew Weinreich]] | launch_date = {{start date and age|1997}} | current_status = Active | revenue = |alexa ={{increasenegative}} 19,062,047 ({{as of|2015|04|18|alt=April 2015}}){{cite web|url=http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/sixdegrees.com|title=Alexa Ranking|publisher=[[Alexa Internet]]|accessdate=18 April 2015}} }} '''SixDegrees.com''' is a [[social network service]] website that initially lasted from 1997{{cite journal|last1=boyd|first1=danah m|last2=Ellison|first2=Nicole B.|date=|year=2007|title=Social Network Sites: Definition, History, and Scholarship|url=http://jcmc.indiana.edu/vol13/issue1/boyd.ellison.html|journal=Journal of Computer-Mediated Communication|volume=13|pages=|accessdate=March 8, 2012|via=|number=1}} to 2001{{cite book | last=Barker | first=Melissa | title=Social Media Marketing: A Strategic Approach | edition=1st | publisher=Cengage Learning | year=2012 | chapter=10}} and was based on the ''[[Web of Contacts]]'' model of social networking. It was named after the [[six degrees of separation]] concept{{Cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101102235354/https://www.nytimes.com/2003/12/01/technology/technology-media-patents-idea-for-online-networking-brings-two-entrepreneurs.html|title=TECHNOLOGY & MEDIA: PATENTS; Idea for Online Networking Brings Two Entrepreneurs Together - New York Times|date=2010-11-02|access-date=2018-07-22}} and allowed users to list friends, family members and acquaintances both on the site and externally; external contacts were invited to join the site. People who confirmed a relationship with an existing user but did not go on to register with the site continued to receive occasional email updates and solicitations. Users could send messages and post bulletin board items to people in their first, second, and third degrees, and see their connection to any other user on the site. SixDegrees was one of the first social networking sites of the general form that is in widespread use today. It was followed by more successful social networking sites based on the "social-circles network model" such as [[Friendster]], [[MySpace]], [[LinkedIn]], [[XING]], and [[Facebook]]. MacroView (later renamed to SixDegrees), the company that developed the site, was founded by CEO [[Andrew Weinreich]] in May 1996{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/pictures/then-and-now-a-history-of-social-networking-sites/2/|title=Then and now: a history of social networking sites|date=2014-02-04|access-date=2018-07-22|language=en}} and was based in [[New York City]]. At its height, SixDegrees had around 100 employees, and the site had around 3,500,000 fully registered members.{{cite book |last1=Kirkpatrick |first1=David |title=[[The Facebook Effect]]: The Inside Story of the Company That Is Connecting the World | publisher = Simon & Schuster | year = 2010 | isbn = 1439102120 }} The site was bought by [[YouthStream Media Networks]] in December 1999 for $125 million.{{cite book | last=Angwin | first=Julia | title=Stealing MySpace: The Battle to Control the Most Popular Website in America | publisher=Random House | year=2009 | page=52}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1999/12/16/business/company-news-youthstream-to-acquire-sixdegrees-for-125-million.html|title=COMPANY NEWS; YOUTHSTREAM TO ACQUIRE SIXDEGREES FOR $125 MILLION|last=Jones|first=Dow|access-date=2018-07-22|language=en}} SixDegrees shut down one year later in 2000, then brought back up a few years later. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== * Bedell, Doug. [https://archive.is/20010104125400/http://www.dougbedell.com/sixdegrees1.html "Meeting your new best friends: Six Degrees widens your contacts in exchange for sampling Web sites"]. ''The Dallas Morning News'', October 27, 1998. {{Online social networking}} [[Category:Internet properties established in 1997]] [[Category:Internet properties disestablished in 2001]] [[Category:Defunct online companies of the United States]] [[Category:Defunct social networking services]] [[Category:1997 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:2001 disestablishments in the United States]]
